newsitem.title: GREECE: SOCCER-OLYMPIAKOS GREEK CHAMPIONS AFTER 10 YEARS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-OLYMPIAKOS GREEK CHAMPIONS AFTER 10 YEARS.

text.p: Olympiakos Piraeus clinched the Greek soccer title for the first time in 10 years on Sunday with a 2-0 win over AEK Athens.
With two rounds to go Olympiakos, unbeaten for 17 matches, head the standings with 78 points, 12 ahead of AEK.
AEK trailed the leaders by nine points before the match and needed a victory to keep their slim hopes alive.
But striker Alexis Alexandris netted in the 12th minute with a right foot shot from inside the box and Yugoslav Predrag Georgevic converted a penalty in the 25th minute.or the final 2-0.
AEK goalkeeper Ilias Atmatsidis was sent off after angrily disputing the penalty call.
"This crown belongs to our fans. They deserve it," said the champions' Serb coach Dusan Bayevic to the cheers of 35,000 fervent fans at the packed Karaiskaki stadium.
It was a highly successful season for the Piraeus club, whose basketball team won the European clubs' championship in Rome last month.
